title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD)--using less water to grow rice

tasks.task: Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD) technique for rice farming
subtasks: Measure water depth in rice field using a field water tube
Reflood the field when water depth is 15 cm below soil surface
Keep water depth at 5 cm during critical stages (peak flowering, grain filling)
Monitor soil moisture using field water tube
Adjust AWD practice based on soil type and field conditions
Create and install a field water tube for monitoring water levels
Bury the field water tube vertically in the soil with half-length protruding
Drill holes in the bottom section of the field water tube for water passage
Check water level inside the field water tube regularly
Start Safe AWD a few days after transplanting or when young rice plants are 10 cm tall
Postpone Safe AWD if weeds are present until they are suppressed
Apply nitrogen fertilizer on dry soil prior to irrigation
Gradually introduce deeper water thresholds (20 cm, 25 cm, 30 cm) upon farmer confidence

tasks.task: Prepare for water savings and yield monitoring
subtasks: Understand the potential water savings and yield impact of AWD
Participate in community-wide adoption of AWD technology
Learn about the benefits of AWD at community and system levels
